A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. In post- colonial 1960s Ireland, a girl with Dystonia – a neurological disorder leading to uncontrolled and severe muscle spasms which makes horses quite impossible to ride safely – manages miraculously to win the Grand National horse race.
